discussion.content:
The correct answer is A.
show etherchannel summary
Number of channel-groups in use: 1
Number of aggregators: 1

Group Port-channel Protocol Ports
------+-------------+-----------+-----------------------------
1 Po1(SU) LACP Gi2/0/23(P) Gi2/0/24(P)

questions.question_text: Which command do you enter to determine whether LACP is in use on a device?

discussion.content:
I think the question is "..... ALL VLAN .....", not ".... a VLAN....".

The choices B and C are not correct answer because of wrong syntax.

I tested the choice D on Packet Tracer, and found that it did nothing.

So, the only choice left is A. However, the question should be modified as I mentioned above.

questions.question_text: Which command do you enter to verify that a VLAN has been removed from a trunk?

choices.D: Switch(config-if)# no switchport trunk allowed vlan add 10
choices.A: Switch(config-if)# switchport trunk allowed vlan none

questions.question_text: What is the Cisco recommended DSCP value for voice traffic?

choices.C: AS numbers are configured in EIGRP but not in EIGRPv3.
choices.B: Only EIGRP for IPv6 requires a router ID to be configured under the routing process.
choices.D: Only EIGRP for IPv6 is enabled in the global configuration mode.
choices.A: Only EIGRP for IPv6 advertises all connected networks.

questions.question_text: Which option describes a difference between EIGRP for IPv4 and IPv6?
Which component of the Cisco SDN solution serves as the centralized management system?

discussion.content: Cisco ACI is a tightly coupled policy-driven solution that integrates software and hardware. ... From a management perspective, the central SDN Controller of the ACI solution, the Application Policy Infrastructure Controller (APIC) manages and configures the policy on each of the switches in the ACI fabric

comments.content:
Answer is C
From a management perspective, the central SDN Controller of the ACI solution, the Application Policy Infrastructure Controller (APIC) manages and configures the policy on each of the switches in the ACI fabric.
https://www.sdxcentral.com/cisco/datacenter/definitions/what-is-cisco-aci/

discussion.content: The correct answer is C, ACI is just the architecture, APIC is the management system in that architecture
